docs.title: What's Jaily ?
docs.text: Jaily is an application linked to your Roblox experience, it provides many features to help you manage your player base and moderate your game.

docs.title: What makes Jaily better than others ?
docs.text: Jaily provides you an enhanced permission system to manage your staff, you can apply granular permissions and give access only to key functions of your game to some people.

docs.title: Bans
docs.text: Ban management is essential for maintaining a healthy community by enabling administrators to temporarily or permanently restrict players who violate community rules.

docs.title: Ban Form
docs.text:
To ban a player, complete the ban form with the necessary information:

  • Player ID: The unique identifier of the player to be banned.
  • Ban End: The end date of the ban. Leave blank for a permanent ban.
  • Permanent: Check this box if the ban is meant to be permanent.
  • Reason: The reason for the ban. Be specific for future reference.

Confirm the ban once the form is completed to enforce it.

docs.title: Search for a banned player
docs.text: Here you can search for a banned player using his ID

docs.title: Ban List
docs.text:
The ban list displays currently banned players with the following details:

  • Player ID
  • Ban Date: The date the ban was enforced.
  • Ban End: The end date of the ban, if applicable.
  • Banisher: The user who enacted the ban.
  • Actions: Includes an icon to view the player's ban history and an icon to unban the player.

Each row in the list can be expanded to display the reason for the ban.

docs.title: Viewing Ban History
docs.text: Click on the history icon to access a player's complete ban history, providing context and understanding of past actions.

docs.title: Unbanning a Player
docs.text: To lift a ban, use the unban icon next to the concerned player. Confirm the action to immediately restore the player's access.

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Accuracy: Ensure the reason for the ban is clear and precise for future reference.
  • Consistency: Apply bans consistently to maintain fairness within the community.
  • Review: Periodically reconsider permanent bans to see if reinstatement is possible.

Effective ban management is crucial for keeping a community healthy and engaging. Use these tools with consideration and in the best interest of your gaming space.

docs.title: Generate API key
docs.text:
First, go to Roblox creator dashboard, select the workspace where your experience is, then click on Open cloud > API Keys

Once you clicked API Keys, click CREATE API KEY

Then, fill infos like this:

You must make sure you give access to the 3 following type of APIs:

  • Datastore
  • OrderedDatastore
  • Messaging service

They are necessary for Jaily to work. Make sure to also give access to the operations listed above.

Finally, in the security tab you must give access to all sources so that we, at Jaily, can access your game from our servers. To do so, you must allow ip 0.0.0.0/0

And set expiration to whatever you want, best is no expiration so you don't have to re-enter your token every period of time on Jaily.

Then you can hit Save & generate key

And copy your newly generated key !

WARNING You won't be able to see this key after, so store it carefully

docs.title: Link Jaily to your experience
docs.text:
To link Jaily to your experience, it's really easy. After generating your token with the method above, you can input it on Jaily in your workspace settings:

In the Update your token category, you can put the token you generated previously

Then hit Save changes

BOOM You're done, Jaily is now linked to your game !

docs.title: Users
docs.text: On Jaily, you can invite your staff in your workspace. It allows you to give them permissions to ban players, or even more if you wish.

docs.title: Searching for users
docs.text: Here you can search for users invited in your workspace, you can search either by username or by email.

docs.title: Remove user from workspace
docs.text: You can remove someone from your workspace by clicking the bin icon at the end of his line in the table.

docs.title: Check user historic
docs.text: Checking user historic allows you to see every action that he's done since he is member of your workspace. This way you can detect easily abuses or even check easily the activity of your staff.

docs.title: Changing user role
docs.text: Changing the role of a member is really easy, after creating the rank in the dedicated page, you can click on the edit button located in Role category.

docs.title: What's a workspace ?
docs.text:
A workspace is a space on Jaily that is linked to your game.

A user can have access to your workspace but also to multiple others, each workspace has its own custom ranks, functions, etc.

docs.title: Workspace name
docs.text: The name displayed for your workspace. You can change it here:

docs.title: Workspace icon
docs.text:
To change workspace icon, you can click "Upload new image" The requirements for your new icon is:

  • 256px X 256px MAX
  • Format: JPG or JPEG or PNG
  • Max size: 1MB

docs.title: Experience token
docs.text: Token is a key used to link Jaily with your experience, you can edit it in workspace settings

docs.title: Upgrade plan
docs.text: You can only upgrade it to a higher plan and not downgrade it.

docs.title: Transfer ownership
docs.text: You can transfer the ownership of your workspace, This will cancel subscription and the new owner will have to input his payment informations. The new payment will take place at the expiration date of previous subscription.
